p.s: The article Globalised Environmental Pollution - Causes and Effects by Ankita Mitra published in Blog on Environment on February 5, 2014 deals with the causes and effects of globalised environmental pollution by humans.
The author claims that the effects of pollution are hazardous.
The life on our world is dependent of the basic elements.
Therefore, she assumes that the age of science and technology are causes for polluting the environment: the urbanization and industrialization.
The author believes that we begin losing control and become victim of our own creation.
Furthermore, the effects are huge on plants, animal and human life.
In her opinion the industrial progress, science and technology had been at the cost of our health.
She states that there are several causes that must be eliminated.
If people won't do something against this immediately there will no longer be life on our planet.
